title: How to edit an account
content:
1. From the main menu, click Accounts.
  2. Click the account in the ID column to display the selected account.
  3. Click the tab you want to view or edit. See the Account details section below. The General tab is displayed by default.
  4. Save your changes.

Account details

General tab

Field Description
ID Account ID.
Name Account name.
User auto-sync Defines whether the system automatically synchronizes users:
  • If this switch is on, the system automatically synchronizes users from LDAP to IdM (every 12 hours), from IdM to Suite Administration (every 2 hours), and from Suite Administration to Service Management (every 2 hours). In addition, when a new user from IdM logs in to the system, the system creates the user in Suite Administration on the fly if the user doesn't exist in Suite Administration.
  • If this switch is off, automatic user synchronization is disabled, and you have to manually synchronize users for the account.
Note You can use the Manage Persons API only to update fields other than UPN/Email/First name/Middle name/Last name/Locale/Office phone number/Home phone number/Mobile phone number. For example, you can use this API to update fields like Manager and Department information.
Shared service type Shared service type:
  • Provider
  • Managed
  • Standard
Note
  • This field editable only if the account is created before the 2020.05 release.
  • If the field is editable but the account has a tenant in the Service Manager backend type, you can't change the shared service type of the account to Provider.
DB user login identifier Login identifier for DB users:
  • Login name
  • Email
Note
  • This field is read-only if you already select Email as the login identifier.
  • If you change the login identifier from Login name to Email, make sure that the email addresses for users (including all authentication types) in this account are unique.
  • If an account contains users with the same login name or email address in different authentication types, the system merges these users to one user and the user is displayed as a DB user in Suite Administration.
Customer Parent customer.
Tier

Account tier:

  • Bronze
  • Silver
  • Gold
  • Platinum
Owner Owner of the account.
Region Region of the account.
Country Country of the account.
State State of the account.
City City of the account.
On boarding date On boarding date of the account.
Description The description that captures the details of the account.

Users tab

This tab displays the users that belong to this account.

  • You can click New to add new users to this account. For more information, see How to create a user.
  • You can change the authentication type of account users. For more information, see Authentication type.
  • You can click Sync now to synchronize users from IdM to Suite Administration.

Tenants tab

This tab displays the tenants that the users of this account can access.

Contacts tab

This tab displays the contact information for this account. You can add or edit the contact.
